It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with compound leaves and produces yellow or white blooms. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots that help it access water from deeper soil layers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
